translation: As an official photographer of Gobi Desert Challenge, I have taken part in two Challenges, the eighth and the ninth.
transcript: 作为戈壁挑战赛的官方摄影师，我参加了两届戈壁挑战赛，第八届和第九届。

translation: For me, an amateur photographer, every participation taught me something new.
transcript: 对于我这个业余喜欢摄影的人来说，每次去的触动都不一样。

translation: In the ninth Gobi Desert Challenge, with two cameras and four lenses, I got 6,588 shots in total.
transcript: 我们就拿戈九来说，我两台相机四个镜头，一共按下6588次快门。

translation: For photographers, It is such a pleasure to press the shutter, as memorable moments are forever recorded in this way.
transcript: 对于摄影师来说，按下快门是一件非常开心的事情，因为精彩的瞬间定格成了永恒的记忆。

translation: When I was sorting out those photos, those images seemed to bring me back to the Challenge.
transcript: 当我回来再整理这些照片的时候，我又一次次地回到了当时。

translation: It took me about a week to categorise the pictures by school and by subject.
transcript: 我用了大概一个星期的时间将这些照片分门别类地进行了整理，按照各个院校，各个主题。

translation: After categorisation, I would see many images be projected onto my mind once I closed my eyes.
transcript: 当我整理完这些照片的时候，你闭上眼睛，就有很多景像像幻灯一片一样地出现在眼前，一幕一幕的。

translation: You would be touched by those bright smiles.
transcript: 你会被这些美丽的笑脸所吸引。

translation: And, some pictures would not only impress you but also strike my heartstring.
transcript: 但是，总有那么几张照片，深深地在你脑海里了，而一次次触动着我的心。

translation: Take a look at this picture.
transcript: 大家看到这张照片。

translation: day of that Challenge, when I was on a helicopter.
transcript: 这是第四天，我在直升飞机上拍下来的这张照片。

translation: I guess I was, um, 2 or 3 km away from the ground.
transcript: 大概我我预估噢两到三公里的距离。

translation: I used my Canon EF 70–200mm lens to zoom in as much as possible, but you can only see a red flag in the vast Gobi Desert.
transcript: 我用小白兔的镜头尽量地把它拉近了，你只看到茫茫戈壁上一面红色的旗帜在前行。

translation: It is impossible to identify the flag-bearer.
transcript: 扛旗的人是谁你无从判断。

translation: Still, I admire the flag-bearer a lot.
transcript: 我特别佩服这位同学。

translation: It was the fourth day; everyone knows the participants had reached the limit physically and mentally at that time.
transcript: 因为这是第四天，大家都知道在体力上、精神上都已经达到了极限。

translation: However, he tenaciously bore the flag, struggled forward, amid the wind which challenged his stamina.
transcript: 他依然能扛着旗、迎着风在向前走着，这对体力来说是一个极大的考验。

translation: It is the flag-bearer's responsibility to carry the flag.
transcript: 作为一个旗手就是应该把旗子扛起来。

translation: In the Gobi Desert, flag-bearers don't represent themselves but their teams, their colleges.
transcript: 因为在戈壁上你不代表的是自己，你代表的是一个集体，是我们自己的院校。

translation: I named my work A Solitary Traveler.
transcript: 我给这幅作品起的名字叫《孤独的行者》。

translation: I believe that only those with a strong heart are able the appreciate the solitude.
transcript: 我相信，只有内心足够强大的人才能享受这份孤独。

translation: And this one, it was taken on the second day of the Challenge, the very first day of the real contest.
transcript: 大家看这张照片是拍摄于第二天，也是我们真正竞赛日的第一天。

translation: On that day, a level-nine dust storm attacked us.
transcript: 九级沙尘暴。

translation: Can you image a level-nine dust storm?
transcript: 九级沙尘暴你知道吗？

translation: We had to stand like this in the storm.
transcript: 是吹的人啊都是这样站的。

translation: You couldn't stand up straight at all.
transcript: 你根本无法正常地站立。

translation: When you look at this picture, you may think that in an extremely formidable environment only a common goal can present us this view.
transcript: 当你看到这张照片的时候，啧你就在想，只有在一个非常恶劣的环境下，只有在一个共同的目标下会自然而然出现这一慕。

translation: Did you see a team in the environment?
transcript: 你有没有发现，在这种环境下，集体就出现了。

translation: Among the team members, the one in camouflage showed the most tenacity.
transcript: 在这个小的集体当中你看到没有那个穿迷彩服的同学最为坚定。

translation: Look, his hands were gripping firmly; his arms was holding his teammates tightly.
transcript: 大家看，两只手紧紧地抓在一起，胳膊死死地扣住了身边的两位同学。

translation: With his head high and eyes forward, he was leading the team to march.
transcript: 抬着头看着前面的方向，带领着大家大踏步地往前走着。

translation: Arm in arm, the five members in the front was a wall against the wind to protect others.
transcript: 前面五位同学手挽手，手挽着手形成了一堵人墙，迎面挡住了风。

translation: In their wake, 10 other members closely followed them, lowering their head.
transcript: 身后有十位同学紧紧地跟在这后面，低着头紧紧地跟在后面。

translation: At that moment, I was impressed by their strong team spirit.
transcript: 这个时候我就感受到一种非常强大的团队的精神。

translation: That is the "Sir Ernest Shackleton spirit" we are seeking for in the desert.
transcript: 是我们在戈壁上执着追求的沙克尔顿精神。

translation: The name of the photo is The strength of the team.
transcript: 我给这张照片起的名字就叫《团队的力量》。

translation: During the four-day challenge, the strength played its role all the way.
transcript: 在戈壁挑战赛的四天当中这种力量无时不刻地存在着。

translation: Although the story varied from team to team, all touched and inspired members and enabled them to unhesitatingly and sturdily march on.
transcript: 或许他们的表现形式各异，但是他们同样感动着、鼓舞着同行的人更坚定更有力地前行。

translation: Let's have a look at this picture.
transcript: 大家看到这张照片。

translation: You can see a backlighting photography with a cucoloris.
transcript: 属于一个非常强烈的逆光，一个剪影的照片。

translation: But it is not a perfect cucoluris.
transcript: 但是我没有处理完全的剪影。

translation: Two red flags were held aloft, the flags of Geyou Foundation.
transcript: 你能看到两面红色的旗子被高高地举起，这是我们戈友公益基金会的旗帜。

translation: The 20 members with various postures are distinctive, as well as energetic.
transcript: 二十位队员表现形式各异，他们都是极具个性的；同样，他们又充满了力量。

translation: Their roles in the foundation has nothing about their universities and colleges; they are neutral in the foundation.
transcript: 他们已经脱离了所有的院校，他们来自于哪个院校是无关紧要的，因为这个时候他们是中立的。

translation: They have been to the Gobi Desert for many times.  How impressive they are!
transcript: 他们来过那么多次戈壁是值得炫耀的一件事儿吗？

translation: I know, averagely, the 20 members have been to the Gobi Desert 3.5 times.
transcript: 我知道，3.5次平均，这二十个人平均3.5次。

translation: I think it is their rich and valuable experience in the Challenge that allows them to fulfill their potential along each routes, especially those challenging routes.
transcript: 但是我认为正是因为有这么多宝贵的赛事经验，所以呢更合理地能将他们安排在每一个赛道的，尤其那些会容易出现问题的赛道上。

translation: Their presence in the Challenge aims to ensure the first-time participants can enjoy their trip to the Gobi Desert light-heartedly and dauntlessly.
transcript: 他们的存在和目的就是要让第一次来戈壁的戈友们，能够心无挂碍、永往直前地来享受自己的戈壁之旅。

translation: The Gobi Desert witnessed a variety of strengths, but I respect the strength of warmth most.
transcript: 在戈壁上我们处处能见到的很多力量的存在，但是我认为一种温暖的力量可能更为强大。

translation: Look, volunteer Wu Shuyang was hugging Yang Hanlun who has intellectual disability.
transcript: 大家能看到，这是志愿者吴舒扬在拥抱乐憨儿杨汉伦。

translation: What a big smile Yang Hanlun is wearing!
transcript: 你看杨汉伦笑得多么开心。

translation: The open arms welcoming the arrivals means much more than words.
transcript: 当他在赛道上张开双臂迎接他到来的时候，语言是苍白的。

translation: During the four days, you might have hugged many and might have been hugged a lot.
transcript: 在戈壁挑战赛的四天当中，你可能拥抱过很多人。

translation: You may forgot who they are, but I am sure you remember all the warmth they gave.
transcript: 你也被很多人拥抱过，但你不记得他们是谁，但我坚信你一定铭记在心。

translation: When you couldn't make a step, or even when you couldn't utter a word, a warm hug from anonymous him or her offered you strengths and supported you to go on.
transcript: 当你在走不动的时候，甚至是话都说不出来的时候，不知名的她或者他，给你的那一记温暖的拥抱，让你实实在在地能感受到一种力量。

translation: I believe the strength has been carved onto your heart.
transcript: 我相信这种力量已经沉淀在你的心里。

translation: Our brains may forget things, but our hearts always remeber things clearly.
transcript: 因为我们脑的记忆比较模糊，也可能消退，但心的记忆是清晰的、永恒的。

translation: I hope the warmth, the strength can be retained in our heart, so I named the work Warmth.
transcript: 我希望这种温暖，这种力量能一直沉淀在我们自己的内每个人心中，我给这幅作品起的名称就是叫《温暖》。

translation: This one was also taken on the first day of contest.
transcript: 大家看到这张照片的时候是在比赛日的第一天。

translation: As I said, there was a severe dust storm; you can see yellow sand was climbing over the camp inch by inch.
transcript: 刚才说过了九级沙尘暴，你就看见黄沙一点一点地掩盖了整个儿营地。

translation: In the morning, a yellow spot appeared in the distance.
transcript: 当你早上起来看到远方有一点点黄色的时候。

translation: I learned from the organising committee that there was very likely to be a dust storm.
transcript: 我从组委会那里得知可能要沙尘暴来了，有可能非常大。

translation: On hearing that news, I rushed back to my camp, and took out all cameras and tripods, as I knew I could have brilliant works in the extreme weather situation.
transcript: 这个时候呢你知道吗，我马上赶紧地跑回营地，把我们的相机什么三脚架全部拿出来，因为大家我知道这个极端天气下才能出大片儿。

translation: I got everything prepared. After about 30 minutes, sand got thicker, turning from yellow to brown.
transcript: 当把这些东西都准备好了之后也就半个小时，黄色由浅变深。

translation: The wind howled with sands, overwhelming every voice in the camp.
transcript: 狂风卷裹着沙粒，呼啸着掩盖了整个儿人世间的声音。

translation: At the beginning of the dust storm, you could see a yellow wall approaching forward silently.
transcript: 一开始的时候你只看到啧远方一个黄色的一堵墙似的，毫无声息地悄悄地来了。

translation: But I never expected the dust storm would greet us in such a fervid way that my face was hurt by its kiss.
transcript: 但是没想到它用这样的方式和我们打了个招呼，特别热情，热情得我脸上都被它亲吻得生疼。

translation: I was in an ecstasy after shooting all magnificent views, yes I was.
transcript: 当我把这些壮观的景象拍摄完了之后非常开心，真的特别开心。

translation: Many photographers who did the same that day gave me a knowing smile.
transcript: 这一天很多拍照的人都对我背波露出来那种，啧，会心的笑容。

translation: After taking the pictures of yellow sand storm overspreading the Gobi Desert, I turned around and noticed our team members had gathered together in front of the gate, neat and uniform, highspirited and vigorous, ready to set out.
transcript: 当我拍完这些照片把这些整儿个黄沙扑扑天盖地掩盖整个儿戈壁的景象完成之后，我回过头看到了我们的队员，整齐划一地集结在了旗门前，气宇轩昂地出发了。

translation: In that environment, probably, they were frightened; they may flinch, but in reality, they started off with boundless enthusiasm.
transcript: 你在想这样的环境下，也许，他有了一些胆怯，他有可能退缩，没有，他们坚定地出发了！

translation: No matter why they did so, maybe because of their self-esteem or their wild ambition, they were courageous.
transcript: 无论他们的，也许他们是为了一些自己的面子，还是为了他们自己的内心，无所谓啊！

translation: The picture always makes me recall a saying: every start leads to the destination.
transcript: 每次我看到这张照片的时候我就能想起一句话：只要出发，就能到达。

translation: I named it Start off.
transcript: 这张作品的名称，我起名是《出发》。

translation: This picture was also taken on the first day of the contest.
transcript: 大家看到这张照片的时候，还是比赛日的第一天。

translation: After photographing all the 31 teams starting off like a great flood, I was looking up pictures.
transcript: 当我咳拍完31个队伍都已经浩浩荡荡出发跑出营地的时候，我在整理照片的时候。

translation: I looked up, saw three figures in the front.
transcript: 抬起头突然看到前方依然还有三个人影。

translation: I zoomed in as much as I could because of poor visibility.
transcript: 我拿起相机来把它尽量地拉近，因为当时能见度非常低。

translation: I saw, oh, Hou Bin, a famous Paralympics champion.
transcript: 我看到，哦，是侯斌，大家都知道侯斌是我们的残奥会冠军。

translation: Despite of the hostile environment, he showed up in the Challenge resolutely.
transcript: 嘶在这种恶劣的环境下，他毅然决然地出现在了路上。

translation: He was fearless in the Challenge.
transcript: 在路上他是无所畏惧的。

translation: You may be good at running, so you can finish the 112 km route within four days, but Hou Bin is slow walker.
transcript: 在路上你可能跑得快，用四天完成了112公里的路程，侯斌走得慢。

translation: It took him four years to finish the 112 km route.
transcript: 他用四年完成了112公里的路程。

translation: It takes four years for him and four days for us to complete the same route, the same distance.
transcript: 四年和四天，路是一样的，距离是一样的。

translation: But I think, the meaning of his completion is special.
transcript: 但是我认为意义是完全不一样的。

translation: From my perspective, walking and running are just a way to conquer the 112 km.
transcript: 在我看来走或者是跑，其实只是一种形式。

translation: Through the route, we fulfilled our potential.
transcript: 这112公里其实就是我们自己的内心的心路。

translation: The day when you complete the 112km route is the day when you outdo yourself, the day when you overcome your weakness.
transcript: 当你走完这112公里的时候，也就是超越我们的那一天，也就是我们超越我们自己内心的那一天。

translation: Hence, I named the photo the Journey to Greatness.
transcript: 这幅作品的名称就是《心路》。

translation: Thank you!
transcript: 谢谢！
